# Writing system

The transliteration is as follows.

Consonants:

|             | labial | dental | palatal | velar | glottal |
|-------------|--------|--------|---------|-------|---------|
| stop        | p b    | t d    | c j     | k g   |         |
| fricative   | f      | s      | sh      |       | h       |
| nasal       | m      | n      |         |       |         |
| approximant | u      | l      | i       |       |         |
| trill       |        | r      |         |       |         |

Vowels:

|      | front | central | back |
|------|-------|---------|------|
| high | i/y   |         | u    |
| mid  | e/ai  |         | o/au |
| low  |       | a       |      |

* [i, e, o] are written as ⟨i, e, o⟩ and ⟨y, ai, au⟩ for historical reasons.
  * Alternative transliterations for ⟨ai, au⟩ are ⟨ê, ô⟩.
